definition[0]: to come from different directions and meet at the same point to become one thing
example[0]: The two rivers converge into one near Pittsburgh.
definition[1]: if groups of people converge in a particular place, they come there from many different places and meet together to form a large crowd
definition[2]: if different ideas or aims converge, they become the same
example[2]: Cultural beliefs about the role of women converge with government policies.
definition[3]: if two or more rates of interest, unemployment etc converge, they move to the same level
example[3]: Irish productivity per worker has converged with the EU norms.
definition[4]: if two or more economies converge, they start to have the same characteristics such as the same levels of inflation, interest rates etc. The economies of countries wanting to join the EU have to converge with those of existing members before they can join
